com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing

Class VmCheckpointingHandlerAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotifierImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing.ProbedImpl
        • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.EntityImpl
          • com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing.CheckpointingHandlerAbstract<VirtualMachine,VmCheckpoint>
            • com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing.VmCheckpointingHandlerAbstract
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, Notifier, Probed, CheckpointingHandler<VirtualMachine,VmCheckpoint>, VmCheckpointingHandler, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    VmCheckpointingHandlerDefault

    public abstract class VmCheckpointingHandlerAbstract
extends CheckpointingHandlerAbstract<VirtualMachine,VmCheckpoint>
implements VmCheckpointingHandler
    This implementation defines a CheckpointingHandlerAbstract which uses the parent CloudProvider policies to select a Storage where to place checkpoints, and to select a host to use for recovered VirtualMachines.

    After that the Storage is selected a VirtualStorage is created on top of the Storage which in turn holds the checkpoint's StorageFile. The VirtualStorage is created in order to reserve space for the checkpoint's StorageFile, and avoid any update error due to lack of space. The reserved space is equal to the VirtualMachine's VirtualRam size plus the VirtualMachine's VirtualStorage size.

    This implementation will reserve in advance resources for the VirtualMachine on a secondary host. This way after a failure, there is immediately a ready host where to place the recovered VirtualMachine.

    The host where a recovered VirtualMachine is to be placed, might be different from the host where the checkpoint is saved. However, you can override the appropriate method (i.e. useSameHostForCheckpointAndRecoveredVm()) so that this implementation will try to place the checkpoint file in the same host as the host where a potentially recovered VM is to be placed.

    Since:
    1.2
    See Also:
    VmCheckpointingHandler

      • register

        public void register(VirtualMachine vm,
            Config checkpointConfig)
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointingHandler
        Registers the given entity, and enables automatic checkpointing and recovery for it.

        The frequency of the checkpointing is defined by the implementation. In a like manner, the choice of the backup MemoryZone to use for saving the created checkpoints is implementation-specific. It is also left to implementations to the chose where a recovered entity is to be placed.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_REGISTERED notification is thrown after that the given entity is registered.
        Additionally, each time a checkpoint is created for a registered entity, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_CREATION_SUCCESS notification is thrown. And if an error happens, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_CREATION_ERROR notification is thrown.

        Each time a checkpoint is automatically updated, a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTOUPDATE_SUCCESS or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTOUPDATE_ERROR notification is thrown.

        Each time a checkpoint is used for recovery, a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTORECOVER_SUCCESS or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTORECOVER_ERROR notification is thrown.

        If after a given set of tries, this handler fails to update (or to recover) a given entity, then the automatic update process and recovery process are aborted for that entity. Additionally, the entity is automatically unregistered (see CheckpointingHandler.unregister(RunnableEntity)).

        After that a checkpoint is successfully used for recovery, the entity that has failed is unregistered (see CheckpointingHandler.unregister(RunnableEntity)) and the newly recovered entity is registered using this same method.

        Specified by:
        register in interface CheckpointingHandler<VirtualMachine,VmCheckpoint>
        Overrides:
        register in class CheckpointingHandlerAbstract<VirtualMachine,VmCheckpoint>
        Parameters:
        vm - the entity to register for automatic checkpointing/recovery
        checkpointConfig - the configuration which is assigned to checkpoints when creating them (can be null, in which case the CheckpointingHandler's config is used)

      • unregister

        public void unregister(VirtualMachine vm)
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointingHandler
        Unregisters the given entity.
        No further automatic checkpointing or automatic recovery is performed.

        All previously automatically created checkpoints by current CheckpointingHandler are deleted using the CheckpointingHandler.deleteCheckpoint(Checkpoint) method.
        Checkpoints created using CheckpointingHandler.takeCheckpoint(RunnableEntity, Config) are not deleted.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_UNREGISTERED notification is thrown after that the given entity is unregistered.

        Specified by:
        unregister in interface CheckpointingHandler<VirtualMachine,VmCheckpoint>
        Overrides:
        unregister in class CheckpointingHandlerAbstract<VirtualMachine,VmCheckpoint>
